answerText: quantitative polymerase chain reaction [or qPCR; or real-time polymerase chain reaction; prompt on RT-PCR][10] When referred to as real-time PCR, qPCR is commonly mistaken for reverse transcription PCR, which is a similar technique that can be used to detect this kind of nucleic acid with ribose and uracil instead of thymine.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | UCSD | 2 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this variant of PCR which is carried out in a thermocycler that illuminates samples with light and detects fluorescence, giving information about DNA amplification as it is happening.
